text:
When a .jmx file is loaded, some fields get leading and trailing whitespace
trimmed off. I see no reason why it should be like this, and I've already found
a few occasions in which it's been annoying.

E.g. try with string " " as the value of an HTTP parameter.

Or try to create an HTTP Parameter Mask Modifier that creates user company names
like "Company 1", "Company 2",...
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
mstover1@apache.org
text: Appears to be a bug in Avalon's code.  I'll direct this there.

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
I've included the newest CVS build of Avalon which fixes some aspects of this
bug, but not all.

I just learned there's an attribute to be set to preserve all spaces.  So now
it's fixed.
creator: mstover1@apache.org

text:
Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com

text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
